metadata.title: CVE-2018-19962 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Xen through 4.11.x on AMD x86 platforms,possibly allowing guest OS users to gain host OS privileges because smallIOMMU mappings are unsafely combined into larger ones.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19962` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.9 - 4.11.1-1
libxenstore3.0 - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.6-amd64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.6-arm64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.6-armhf - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.7-amd64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.7-arm64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.7-armhf - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.8-amd64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.8-arm64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.8-armhf - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.9-amd64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.9-arm64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.9-armhf - 4.11.1-1
xen-system-amd64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-system-arm64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-system-armhf - 4.11.1-1
xen-utils-4.9 - 4.11.1-1
xen-utils-common - 4.11.1-1
xenstore-utils - 4.11.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.1-1').
